comments.body: We can get rid of the `filter` and use a list comprehension to filter. That way when we migrate to Python 3, it will still work without any additional changes.

comments.body:
```python
# four lines --> one...
# normalize string literals from ' into " and turn pseudo-booleans strings into Booleans
return config.replace('\'', '"').replace('"true"', 'true').replace('"false"', 'false')
```

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +287,291 @@  config = re.sub('"true"', 'true', config)
  config = re.sub('"false"', 'false', config)
  return config

comments.body: Why not just keep the current convention? This is actually a breaking change for this script, but in a refactoring patch? I don't suppose it is necessary for maximal py3 compat here?

It's part of a dependency bug fix. `tools/js2c.py` was not declared as a dependency.
https://github.com/nodejs/node/blob/6bd301c6133371594630e1bdcb51e0743abc9eb0/node.gyp#L862-L863
adding an explicit argument for output allows a succinct gyp implementation.

P.S. As for the semverity of this change... It's a good point and I'll think about it some more. My intuition was to consider this script as an internal tool, and since there is not change in `./configure` or `Makefile` I would consider this abstracted away.
